DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Subject Identifier 64 Character Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The assigned identifier for the patient as a clinical trial subject.  [Standard-based]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize a person that is analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, treated in the course of a research study, also called a clinical study.  [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:A matter or person that is analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, treated in the course of particular study.

Concepts.definition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.

Property.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/13/2015 removed upside down question mark from change note. jk 12/10/08 - replaced retired concept C15207 with C71104.  12/9/08 - released post VCDE Interim Silver Review changes.  9/14/07  updated for NCIA model updates.  6/7/07 -DEC created to support DICOM CDE task utilizing IE DICOM Attribute terms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: LO: A 64-character string with leading or trailing spaces being non-significant; NO CONTROL characters. [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/30/13 added DICOM RT CSI. jc 3/16/09 - set min length from 0 to 1. 2007 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6 2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 8/30/11 added DICOM definitions.  12/10/08 - replaced retired concept C15207 with C71104; released post NCIA Interim Silver Review changes.
